intro: Barringtonia racemosa var. elongata, commonly known as the long-fruited lantern tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lantern-shaped fruits that hang in clusters. The plant has large, palmate leaves and produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom at night. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The elongated fruit capsules are unique to this variety and contribute to its ecological importance as a food source for various wildlife species.
